newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan shipping shares up sharply on China news.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan shipping shares up sharply on China news.

text.p: Taiwan's shipping shares rose sharply at mid-session on Monday after the government said it was considering expanding the scope of plans for direct shipping links with rival China, brokers said.
With 70 minutes left, First Steamship was up 5.94 percent or T$1.20 to T$21.40, Evergreen Transport 5.69 percent or T$3.50 to T$65 and Tze Shin Transport 5.15 percent or T$1.20 to T$24.50.
The communications' ministry said on Monday it may allow foreign-registered vessels to extend their routes to third areas after they are allowed to sail between China and Taiwan.
"Investors are looking for a sector to boost the market, and the news attracted them toward shipping shares," said Lin Long-hsien of United Securities.
Taiwan and China, separated by a civil war in 1949, still have no direct shipping, aviation or other communication links.
Taiwan proposed in 1995 to set up an offshore transshipment centre at its southern Kaohsiung port from which ships would be allowed to sail directly across the Taiwan Strait.
The project has been delayed by sovereignty issues.
